description: Mentioned in the Wycliffe Bible as ybyn or ibin, as ibys from 16th century and ibis shortly after.  From Latin ībis, from Ancient Greek ἶβις (îbis), from Egyptian

nouns.description: ibis (plural ibis or ibises or ibides or ibes)

entries.meaning: Any of various long-legged wading birds in the family Threskiornithidae, having long downcurved bills used to probe the mud for prey such as crustaceans.
